all_plans.title: Summer Afternoon Weight Loss Plan (Lite)

exercises.name: Outdoor Cycling
instructions: Cycle at a steady, conversational pace on a flat route
Maintain a consistent cadence
Enjoy the clear weather
exercises.reason: Primary cardio exercise; effective for calorie burn and suitable for diabetes management in pleasant summer conditions.
safety_notes: Check blood sugar before and after exercise
Stay well-hydrated in the 25°C heat
Wear sunscreen

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squats
equipment: optional: chair or bench for rear foot
instructions: Stand facing away from a bench
Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you
Lower your hips until your front thigh is parallel to the floor
Keep your torso upright
Perform equal reps on both legs
exercises.reason: Primary strength exercise; builds lower body muscle to boost metabolism, using only bodyweight for safety.
safety_notes: Focus on balance and control, not speed
Ensure the supporting surface is stable
Stop if you feel knee pain

exercises.name: Child's Pose
instructions: Kneel on the floor, touch your big toes together, and sit on your heels
Separate your knees about hip-width
Exhale and lay your torso down between your thighs
Rest your forehead on the mat and extend your arms forward or alongside your body
Hold and breathe deeply
exercises.reason: Flexibility element; provides a gentle stretch and cool-down, promoting relaxation and recovery.
safety_notes: Avoid if you have knee injuries
Breathe deeply to enhance the stretch
Modify by placing a pillow under your torso if needed

all_plans.reasoning: This plan prioritizes outdoor activity (cycling) in the clear summer weather for enjoyable cardio. It combines moderate-intensity cycling for primary calorie burn with bodyweight strength training (Bulgarian Split Squats) to build metabolism-boosting muscle, adhering to diabetes safety guidelines. The session concludes with a flexibility exercise (Child's Pose) for cool-down. The total calorie burn is slightly below the 400 kcal target to prioritize safety and moderate intensity for an intermediate user with diabetes, focusing on sustainable, balanced training.
safety_notes: Check blood glucose levels before and after the session
Avoid exercise during peak insulin activity (typically 1-3 hours after meals)
Carry a fast-acting carbohydrate source during the workout
Stay hydrated, especially in warm weather
Listen to your body and reduce intensity if feeling dizzy or unwell

recommendations: Start gradually and listen to your body
Stop immediately if you experience pain or discomfort
Stay hydrated before, during, and after exercise
Consult healthcare provider before starting due to: diabetes
